msDesc.head: Composite: A Goswinus de Bossuto, Vita Arnulfi conversi; Germany, 13th century, second quarter. B Echardus Magister, Opus Tripartitum (parts); Germany, 14th century. C Serapion the Elder, Practica; France (?), 13th century, second half

binding.p: Laudian binding. Sewn on five bands and bound in plain brown leather over pasteboards, each cover framed by a double blind fillet and with the gilt arms of Archbishop Laud in the centre; with traces of ties. The head of the spine with a paper label inscribed ‘Glossa super Genesin | &c. | M. S.’, above two printed paper Bodleian labels, ‘Laud. | E 3[4].’ and ‘Laud | 222’. The upper edges of the leaves are inscribed with a medieval(?) title (?) or ex libris (?).

history.provenance: The whole volume together by at least 1502, when identifiable as h9 in the catalogue of the Cistercian abbey of Eberbach (Nigel F. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher: die mittelalterliche Bibliotheksgeschichte von Kloster Eberbach im Rheingau (Regensburg, 1998), p. 274).
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639.

recordHist.source: Summary description (March 2021) by Peter Kidd, edited by Matthew Holford. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 192 Quarto Catalogue, col. 193 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 40

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Nigel F. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher: die mittelalterliche Bibliotheksgeschichte von Kloster Eberbach im Rheingau (Regensburg, 1998), p. 290
Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, I (1966), no. 120 (part A only)

msItem.author: Goswinus de Bossuto OCist
msItem.title: Vita Arnulfi conversi

msItem.rubric: Incipit prefatio in vitam famuli dei fratris Arnulfi conuersi Villariensis
msItem.incipit: Sicit in germinibus herbarum atque lignorum que terra producit non una species
msItem.explicit: eius gesta adiuuante domino describemus. Explicit prefatio.

msItem.incipit: Fuit in episcopatu Cameracensi in oppido quodam terre Brabantine quod Bruxella dicitur, adolescens quidam Arnulfus nomine
msItem.explicit: migrauit de hac uita immo de hac morte ad uitam … qui uenit in hunc mundum ut uitam habeamus et abundantius habeamus, cui est cum patre … per omnia secula seculorum. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit vita serui dei fratris Arnulfi Villariensis
msItem.note: Book II begins on fol. 11r; each book is preceded by a capitula list. Arnulf’s death in 1228 is recorded at fol. 28r, line 13.

msItem.rubric: Versus de conuersatione et obitu eiusdem
msItem.incipit: Nobilis egrediens hospes de corpore mortis
msItem.explicit: Viuit nunc anima melius quam uixerat ante

msItem.note: BHL, no. 713; Acta Sanctorum, Junii, V (Antwerp 1709), pp. 608C–631E. Here incomplete, missing the final epitaph, which is an additional 36 lines in the printed edition; translated into English by Martin Cawley in Goswin of Bossut, Send me God: The lives of Ida the compassionate of Nivelles, nun of La Ramée, Arnulf, lay brother of Villers, and Abundus, monk of Villers (Turnhout 2003), 125–208.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in plummet for 31 lines written above top line. Ruled space 185–90 115–20

handDesc.handNote: Gothic bookhand; capitals stroked in red

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials in red with leafy and other ornament, mostly 3 lines high, sometimes extending along much of the height of the margin. According to Palmer, p. 290, by the same hand as the initials in MS. Laud Misc. 287 and London, BL, Arundel MS. 245.

history.provenance: 'Probably' written at Eberbach according to Palmer, p. 290.

msItem.author: Echardus Magister
msItem.title: Liber parabolarum Genesis

msItem.incipit: Expeditis in prima edicione que dicenda videbantur quantum ad sensum aperciorem
In principio creavit deus celum et terram. Prima auctoritas primi capituli Genesis et exponitur symbolice siue parabolice
msItem.explicit: ibi habes auctoritates duas Crisostomi et Augustini pulchras de innocentia.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tabula. Aliam secundum ordinem alphabeti habes plus in fine huus exposicionis.

msItem.incipit: In principio creavit deus celum et terram. Verbum hoc in prima editione multipliciter exponitur
msItem.explicit: onerosum legentibus opus fieret et diffusum

msItem.incipit: Incipit tabula contentorum in hoc libro secundum ordinem alphabeti verbi

msItem.bibl: Magistri Echardi Prologi in opus tripartitum, Expositio libri Genesis, secundum recensionem Cod. Oxoniensis Bodleiani Laud misc. 222 (L), Liber parabolarum Genesis …, Meister Eckhart, Die lateinischen Werke, Bd 1.2, ed. by Loris Sturlese (Stuttgart, 2015)

msItem.author: Echardus Magister
msItem.title: Prologues to the Opus tripartitum, and Commentary on Genesis
Prologus generalis in opus tripartitum
msItem.rubric: Prologus iste generalis qui premittitur primo docet auctoris intentionem
msItem.incipit: Auctoris intentio on hoc opere tripartito est satisfacere pro posse studiosorum fratrum quorundam desideriis
msItem.explicit: in initiis scilicet trium operum plenius pertractanda

msItem.title: Prologus in opus propositionum
msItem.incipit: Esse deus est. Incipit pars prima tripartiti opus scilicet propositionum
msItem.explicit: Esse et deus etc. Isti immediate debet continuari opus propositionum siue liber.

msItem.title: Prologus in opus expositionum I
msItem.incipit: In principio creauit deus celum et terram. Operis tripartiti pars tercia principalis opus scilicet expositionum incipit

msItem.title: Expositio libri Genesis
msItem.incipit: In principio creauit deus celum et terram. Circa premissam auctoritatem quatuor sunt notanda
msItem.explicit: quod a tot sapientibus concorditer approbatum est
msItem.note: Pen-trials below include ‘Qui scripsit hoc sit benedictus a deo suo Amen.’

msItem.bibl: Magistri Echardi Prologi in opus tripartitum, Expositio libri Genesis, secundum recensionem Cod. Oxoniensis Bodleiani Laud misc. 222 (L), Liber parabolarum Genesis … , Meister Eckhart, Die lateinischen Werke, Bd 1.2, ed. by Loris Sturlese (Stuttgart, 2015)

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in ink for 2 columns of 40 lines, generally written below top line but occasionlly above and sometimes with three lines of text below the ruled area. Ruled space 170–5 110–5 with c. 15 mm. between columns.

msItem.author: Serapion the Elder (Yuhanna ibn Sarabiyun)
msItem.title: Practica
msItem.rubric: Tractatus primus breuiarii filii Serapionis medici translatus a magistro Girardo Cremonensi de Arabico in Latinum. Inquid Iohannes
msItem.incipit: Incipiamus cum auxilio dei et bonitate inspirationis eius librum abbreviatum
Egritudines iste a duabus eueniunt causis
msItem.explicit: sumatur gallarum quantum necesse est et ponatur in
msItem.note: Ends imperfect due to loss of leaves.

Frequent near-contemporary marginalia by more than one reader, sometimes extensive; sometimes referring to Galen, e.g. ‘Nota autem .G. in libro de ciriaca …’ (fol. 114v). Other marginal additions include chapter numbers in Arabic numerals.

supportDesc.support: parchment, with sporadic holes and other flaws
supportDesc.collation: 15(12+1) (fols. 104–16, probably a leaf added at the end of the quire), 16(12)-17(12) (fols. 117–40), 18(10) (fol. 141–50), 19(14) (fols. 151–64), 20(12) (fols. 165–76), 21(12–1) (fols. 177–87, 6 missing after fol. 181), 22(12)-25(12) (fols. 188–235). Quire signatures on the bottom centre of the final verso.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in plummet for 2 columns of 47 lines written below top line. Ruled space 185 120 with c. 10 mm. between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Gothic bookhand, with a distinct change of ink and introduction of a more cursive looped ‘d’ for most of fol. 133v

decoDesc.decoNote: Large puzzle initials in red and blue with flourishing in both colours introduce the beginnings of treatises II–VII (fols. 118v, 137r, 150v, 172r, 191r, 198v), ; most initials alternately red or blue, with flourishing in the other colour; those on the first page (fol. 104r) apparently left blank and supplied later in cruder style, in plain red or brown and red.

revisionDesc.change: Description fully revised for Polonsky German digitization project.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
